Package jnet

Class JServer

java.lang.Object
jnet.JServer
public abstract class JServer extends Object
C-style server template. This class provides the framework to create a server compatible with the processes of this library. By default, the server runs on 127.0.0.1:9000, but this can be changed with the second constructor.

Some notable abstract methods include:

Abstract Methods
Method Commentary
clientConnected Called when a new client connects to the server, passing in the client's socket object so messages can be sent.
clientCommunicated Called when any client sends a message to the server, passing in the bytes sent and the client's socket object.

Some notable threads created by this class include:

Threads
Thread Commentary
clientThread Created by Server::add. Runs the Server::listenOnClient method for a given client connection, so that the server can continue accepting new clients in parallel.
See Also:
  • clientConnected(jnet.JClientSocket)
  • clientCommunicated(byte[],jnet.JClientSocket)

  • Constructor Details

    • JServer

      public JServer() throws IOException
      Default constructor for a server. This constructor uses the default IP address and port defined as instance variables of this class.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the server cannot be bound to the IP address and port.

    • JServer

      public JServer(String ip, int port) throws IOException
      Constructs a JServer object with a given IP address and port.
      Parameters:
      ip - the IP address to start the server on.
      port - the port to start the server on.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the server cannot be bound to the IP address and port.

  • Method Details

    • getIP

      public String getIP()
      Returns the IP address the server has been binded to.
      Returns:
      the IP address the server has been binded to.

    • getPort

      public int getPort()
      Returns the port this server has been binded to.
      Returns:
      the port this server has been binded to.

    • clientConnected

      public abstract void clientConnected(JClientSocket clientSocket)
      Performs an arbitrary action when a client first connects. Called by the private JServer::add method before the client's thread is started.
      Parameters:
      clientSocket - the client that connected.

    • clientDisconnected

      public abstract void clientDisconnected(JClientSocket clientSocket)
      Performs an arbitrary action when a client disconnects. Called by the private JServer::listenOnClient method before the client is removed from this JServer's scope.
      Parameters:
      clientSocket - the client that disconnected.

    • clientCommunicated

      public abstract void clientCommunicated(byte[] recv, JClientSocket clientSocket)
      Performs an arbitrary action when a client sends a message. Called by the private Server::listenOnClient method after validating the received message. The argument recv is guaranteed to contain a valid, non-null message
      Parameters:
      recv - the message received from the client
      clientSocket - the client who sent the message

    • send

      public void send(byte[] payload, JClientSocket clientSocket)
      Sends a message to a client as a byte array.
      Parameters:
      payload - a byte array to send.
      clientSocket - the client to send to.
      See Also:
      • JServerSocket

    • send

      public void send(String payload, JClientSocket clientSocket)
      Sends a message to a client as a string.
      Parameters:
      payload - a string to send.
      clientSocket - the client to send to.
      See Also:
      • JServerSocket

    • sendAll

      public void sendAll(byte[] payload)
      Sends a message to all clients as a byte array.
      Parameters:
      payload - a byte array to send to all clients.
      See Also:
      • JServerSocket

    • sendAll

      public void sendAll(String payload)
      Sends a message to all clients as a string.
      Parameters:
      payload - a string to send to all clients.
      See Also:
      • JServerSocket

    • remove

      public void remove(JClientSocket clientSocket)
      Removes a connected client. If the argument clientSocket is null, no action is taken. This method also interrupts the thread that was running for the given client.
      Parameters:
      clientSocket - the client connection to remove.

    • close

      public void close()
      Unbinds this server server from its port. Before the server is closed, any clients connected are disconnected with the remove method of this server.
      See Also:
      • remove(jnet.JClientSocket)
